HOTSPOT

For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

DRAG DROP
-

A company that provides house cleaning services uses Dynamics 365 Customer Service.

The company wants to set up service scheduling. The company needs to gather the following information:

• Cities in which services are offered.
• Personnel and equipment needed to perform services.
• Availability of personnel.

You need to recommend configuration options.

Which configuration option should you recommend? To answer, drag the appropriate configurations to the correct requirements. Each configuration may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
If I'm adding Personnel - as in users - then it's Resources. Not Resource Groups.
If they mean 'Personnel' as a type of resource (compared to Equipment) then it's a Resource Group.

1. Cities in which services are offered: This can be managed by creating Organizational Units. Organizational units can be used to organize and maintain a company’s business by geography, function, or other areas.

2. Personnel and equipment needed to perform services: This can be handled by setting up Resources. Resources in Dynamics 365 Customer Service can represent anything that needs to be scheduled, including people, equipment, and physical spaces.

3. Availability of personnel: This can be defined by setting up Work Hours for a resource. By default, the resources are set up for a 7-days-a-week, 24-hour schedule. However, you can customize this to define the hours a resource is available.
